Package com.example.eventscan.Fragments

Class EventFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.eventscan.Fragments.EventFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner, DeleteEvent.DeleteEventListener, SendNotificationFragment.SendNotificationListener
public class EventFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment implements DeleteEvent.DeleteEventListener, SendNotificationFragment.SendNotificationListener
A fragment subclass that handles the displaying of events in two listviews. As of writing, it displays both attending classes and owned classes as the same thing, which is all the events on the firestore. Clicking on an item in the ownedEvents list brings up a delete dialog.
